description: The '''''funaná''''' {{IPA|pt|funɐˈna|}} is a music and dance genre from [[Cape Verde]]. ''Funaná'' is an accordion-based music. The rhythm is usually provided by the '''''[[ferrinho]]''''' much like the use of [[washboard (musical instrument)|washboard]]s in zydeco, the saw in Caribbean [[ripsaw music]]{{Citation needed|date=April 2013}}, the [[Scraper (instrument)|scraper]] in Sub-Saharan African music{{Citation needed|date=April 2013}} and the [[güiro]] in Latin and Pre-Columbian music{{Citation needed|date=April 2013}}.
